result.execSummary:
The defendant Lissette N Miranda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: **05-10-16/Order commuting probation term to one year.

miscConds.notes: *  Pay a fine in the amount of $150.00 including all costs and surcharges by July 5, 2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*  No contact with Pick and Save on National Avenue;

*  Mental health evaluation/treatment deemed appropriate;
*  Cooperate with any programming ordered by agent;

*  AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate;
*  Maintain absolute sobriety;

Defendant Lissette N Miranda in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  The defendant was in court in the a.m. to address the JusticePoint violation but was told to return in the p.m. due to the lateness of the hour.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Case remains calendared for plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.

Defendant Lissette N Miranda in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense request for an adjournment. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lissette N Miranda not in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/27/15 @ 1:30pm
